metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8600 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in KDE-Runtime 4.14.3and earlier, kwebkitpart 1.3.4 and earlier, and kio-extras 5.1.1 andearlier allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via acrafted URI using the (1) zip, (2) trash, (3) tar, (4) thumbnail, (5)smtps, (6) smtp, (7) smb, (8) remote, (9) recentdocuments, (10) nntps, (11)nntp, (12) network, (13) mbox, (14) ldaps, (15) ldap, (16) fonts, (17)file, (18) desktop, (19) cgi, (20) bookmarks, or (21) ar scheme, which isnot properly handled in an error message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kde-runtime - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2
kde-runtime-data - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2
kdebase-runtime - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2
khelpcenter4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2
plasma-scriptengine-javascript - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

kpart-webkit - 1.3~git20120518.9a111005-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kde-runtime package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.2').
webkitkde package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3~git20120518.9a111005-3ubuntu1').
